citation.article-title: Aeromonas tecta sp. nov., isolated from clinical and environmental sources

p.s: Description of Aeromonas tecta sp. nov.
A. tecta (tec’ ta. L. fem. adj. tecta, hidden, concealed)

Strains display the typical characteristics of the genus Aeromonas: Gram-negative, straight, motile rods, cytochrome oxidase-positive, chemoorganotrophic with both oxidative and fermentative metabolisms, catalase-positive and resistance to vibriostatic agent 0/129 (150 μg).
A brown diffusible pigment is not produced.
Optimal growth occurs at 30 °C after 24 h on sheep-blood agar with the production of β-haemolysis.
Strains do not grow at 42 or 4 °C.
Acid and gas are produced from glucose.
Strains are unable to produce indole.
Arginine dihydrolase-positive, ornithine decarboxylase-negative, and Voges–Proskauer are variable (type strain CECT7082T positive).
They can hydrolyze casein, lecithin, arginine-arginine, l-arginine, l-glutamate, l-leucine, l-proline, lysine-alanine, and N-acetyl-glucosaminide.

Lysine decarboxylase and hydrolysis of aesculin (type strain CECT7082T negative), bis-phosphate, glutaryl-glycine-arginine, glycine, glycine-proline, glucoside, l-phenylalanine, l-pyroglutamate, and γ-l-glutamil are variable.

Acid is produced from arbutin, glycerol, dextrose, d-fructose, d-gluconate, and N-acetyl-glucosamine, but not from d-cellobiose, lactose, l-arabinose, α-methyl-d-glucoside, β-allose, d-melibiose, galacturonic acid, l-rhamnose, maltulose, N-acetyl-galactosamine, saccharose, and sorbitol.
Acid from salicin is generally produced, whereas acid from d-galactose is usually negative.

All strains are able to use caprate, d-glucose, d-galactose, glycerol, d-fructose, d-maltose, d-mannose, d-ribose, glycogen, l-histidine, l-proline, l-serine, arbutin, salicin, d-mannitol, d-trehalose, amidon (starch), gentiobiose, potassium gluconate, and α-ketoglutaric acid but not l-arabinose, d-arabinose, d-sorbitol, l-rhamnose, dl-lactate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, inositol, d-melibiose, d-saccharose, 2-ketogluconate, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, 5-ketogluconate, itaconate, l-fucose, d-fucose, malonate, propionate, suberate, erythrol, d-xylose, d-adonitol, methyl-β d-xylopyranoside, l-sorbitol, dulcitol, methyl-α d-mannopyranoside, methyl-α d-glucopyranoside, amygdalin, d-cellobiose, d-lactose, inulin, d-melezitose, d-raffinose, xylitol, d-turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose, d-arabinol, l-arabitol, and valeric acid.
Growth on l-alanine, l-histidine, acetate, adonitol, citrate, malonate, tiglic acid, and l-xylose are variable.

Type strain CECT7082T is resistant to ampicillin (10 μg), amoxicillin (10 μg), amoxicillin/clavulanic acid (30 μg), ticarcillin (75 μg), ticarcillin/clavulanic acid (85 μg), cephalothin (30 μg), and erythromycin (15 μg), shows intermediate resistance to amikacin (30 μg), gentamicin (10 μg), tobramycin (10 μg) and kanamycin (30 μg), and is sensitive to piperacillin (100 μg), piperacillin/tazobactam (110 μg), cefoxitin (30 μg), cefotaxime (30 μg), cefoperazone (30 μg), ceftazidime (30 μg), ceftriaxone (30 μg), cefepime (30 μg), aztreonam (30 μg), imipenem (10 μg), ciprofloxacin (5 μg), norfloxacin (10 μg), trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole (25 μg), tetracycline (30 μg), and chloramphenicol (30 μg).
The type strain is F518T (CECT7082T, DSM17300T, MDC91T).
